Participants in these courses are bound by the University of Notre Dame Code of Honor:

        “As a member of the Notre Dame community, I will not participate in or tolerate academic dishonesty.”

Any incidents of academic dishonesty will be dealt with in accord with the policies of the Code of Honor.

Courses

Fall 2017: Advanced Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics (CBE 60553)
        MWF 10:30 am - 11:20 am, 115 O’Shag
        Text: DePablo and Schieber, Molecular Engineering Thermodynamics, Cambridge
        Content available on Github

Spring 2017: Physical Chemistry for Chemical Engineers (CHEM 30324)
        MWF 12:50 - 1:40, 155 DBRT
        Optional Text: Engel and Reid, Physical Chemistry, Benjamin-Cummings (ISBN: 080533842X)
        Content available on Github

Spring 2016: Introduction to Chemical Engineering (CBE 20255)
        MWF 10:30 am - 11:20 am, 356A Fitzpatrick
        Text: Felder, Rousseau, and Bullard, Elementary Principles of Chemical Processes, Wiley

Spring 2015: Computational Chemistry (CBE 40447/60547)
        TTh 12:30 - 1:45 pm, 240 DBRT

Fall 2011: Chemical Reaction Engineering (CBE 40445)
        MWF 10:40 - 11:30 am, 140 DBRT
        Text: Schmidt, The Engineering of Chemical Reactions, 2nd ed., Oxford University Press
